page.title: 11Cricket at Stone
page.content: Stone Cricket Club is in Lichfield Road.It is quite large.A big mower is used for cutting the outfield and the car park.There is a large roller which is rolled over the wicket to make the ground level.The wicket is mown with a lawnmower which cuts the grass very low.There is a spiker for punching holes in the ground so that the pitch will drain, and a line marker which is used to mark the boundary.There are two big metal covers, nets for pracising and two sight screens. The players have lunch and tea in the pavillion.Stone Cricket Club plays in the Kidsgrove League and the North Staffordshire and South Cheshire League.There are county matches every year.
